name: 2-Data Description and Preparation
content:
Data Description:

The project uses four key datasets:

1.Customers: Contains distributor-customer relationships with metadata like customer start date and country.

  • Variables: Distributor ID, Customer ID, Customer Name, Start Date, Country (categorical).

2.Products: Contains product hierarchy and SKU details.

  • Variables: Sector, Category, Subcategory, SKU ID (categorical).

3.Distributors: Contains distributor-level information with region.

  • Variables: Distributor ID, Distributor Name, Country (categorical).

4.Sales Transactions: Core transactional dataset capturing weekly invoices, product sales, and pricing details.

  • Variables: Invoice Date, SKU ID, Quantity (numerical), Gross, Unit Price (numerical), Week Number, Adjustments, Discounts, Net Value.
  • Granularity: Transaction-level at customer–SKU–week.
  • Time coverage: Example data spans January 2022; in practice, multi-period data will be used for modeling.

Data Preparation:

Steps required include:

  • Data Cleaning: Handle missing values, incorrect SKUs, and date formatting. Remove duplicate invoices.
  • Feature Engineering:
  • Create derived variables such as discounted price, effective margin, and log-transformed demand and price for elasticity modeling.
  • Aggregate sales to customer–SKU–week level.
  • Data Transformation:
  • Normalize continuous variables (price, quantity).
  • Encode categorical variables (distributor, country, sector).
  • Outlier Treatment: Winsorize extreme values in price and demand to reduce skewness.
description: Displaying details of dataset used and also list out additional features that have been computed.
